page.title: 10MOAT FARM
page.content: MOAT FARM - MR.KEENE ARABLE FARMING Arable farming is very predominant in this area of Gloucestershire. The farms are generally very large and highly mechanized. We visited two arable farms as part of our project, Moat Farm and Ploddy House. Moat Farm consists of 500 acres,(200 Hectares). The farm name comes from the fact that the farmhouse stands on an island with a bridge over the moat. The house and some of the farm dates back to 1640 but the majority of the house was rebuilt in 1892. Mr. Keene has owned the farm for 30 years and he has gradually built the farm up to its present size. He employs 5 workers and they all work full-time. They all live locally and they travel to work by car or bike. They work a 40 hour week, which is generally 8 hours for 5 days.
